title: Homeland Security Demands Social Media Sites Reveal Names Behind Anti-ICE Posts
summary: The department has sent Google, Meta and other companies hundreds of subpoenas for information on accounts that track or comment on Immigration and Customs Enforcement, officials and tech workers said.

title: Prosecutor Seeks Dismissal of Charges Against Man Shot by ICE
summary: A judge dropped charges against the immigrant and another man after the top federal prosecutor in Minnesota said new evidence was not consistent with the agents’ testimony.

title: ICE Agents Menaced Minnesota Protesters at Their Homes, Filings Say
summary: Protesters in Minneapolis and St. Paul said in sworn statements that they were singled out by agents who demonstrated that they knew where they lived.

title: Department of Homeland Security Shuts Down, Though Essential Work Continues
summary: Though funding for the department ran out early Saturday, officials said its essential functions would continue.

title: RFK Jr. Allies Target States to Overturn Vaccine Mandates for Schools
summary: Proponents of vaccines warn that the efforts will further dismantle the immunization infrastructure and lead to more outbreaks of disease.

title: Ramping Up Election Attacks, Trump Does Not Let Reality Get in His Way
summary: President Trump increases his attacks when he fears an election loss. With midterm elections approaching, he has gone into overdrive as Republicans face potential losses.

title: Who Is Jeremy Carl, Trump’s Nominee to Lead the State Department?
summary: Jeremy Carl, President Trump’s nominee to lead the State Department’s outreach to international organizations, had a rough confirmation hearing, but he stood by his views on “whiteness.”

title: Casey Wasserman Will Sell Entertainment Agency Amid Epstein Files Fallout
summary: Casey Wasserman, a Los Angeles entertainment executive and the head of the 2028 Olympic Games, has lost clients since his emails with Ghislaine Maxwell surfaced.

title: The Mutually Beneficial Ties Between Jeffrey Epstein and Thorbjorn Jagland
summary: Thorbjorn Jagland, a former prime minister of Norway who led the Nobel Committee, promised influence, and the disgraced financier had gifts to give, new emails show.

title: Consultants Offered Epstein Access to Top N.Y. Democrats if He Donated
summary: Dynamic SRG repeatedly, and apparently unsuccessfully, asked the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein to donate to House races, Justice Department records show.

title: How China Built a Chip Industry, and Why It’s Still Not Enough
summary: More than a decade into Beijing’s push for self sufficiency, Chinese firms are producing fewer, lower-performing chips than their foreign competitors.

title: At Munich Summit, European Leaders Agree With Trump: The Old World Order Is Over
summary: At the Munich Security Conference, U.S. officials softened their tone but not their message: Europe should pay its own way. European leaders increasingly agree.

title: Ocasio-Cortez Offers a Working-Class Vision in Munich, With a Few Stumbles
summary: Speaking at Europe’s largest security conference, she tied income inequality to the rise of authoritarians and offered a forceful rebuttal to President Trump’s worldview. She also had some shaky moments.

title: ’The Interview’: Gisèle Pelicot Shares Her Story
summary: In her first interview with an American media outlet, Pelicot opens up about surviving years of secret abuse — and a trial that shocked the world.

title: White House Sees Win After 2 Strong Economic Reports
summary: Solid jobs data and a soft inflation reading for January are welcome news for President Trump. But the bigger economic picture is less encouraging.

title: Crises Everywhere, but the Markets Don’t Seem to Mind
summary: Stocks have prospered while the world has plunged into disorder, an economist says. “Keep calm and carry on” may be the best investors can do.

title: Au Pair Juliana Peres Magalhães Sentenced to 10 Years in Banfield Double Murder Case
summary: Juliana Peres Magalhães, 25, had cooperated with prosecutors, who sought a lenient sentence. But the judge said the woman, who pleaded guilty to manslaughter, merited the state maximum.

title: How ‘The Traitors’ Builds Its Perfect Reality TV Cast
summary: The casting executives behind the Emmy-winning reality competition reveal how they create a mad mix of modern celebrity.

title: One Last Chat With David Brooks
summary: Before leaving The Times after 22 years, David Brooks responds to readers’ questions.

title: The One Child Policy’s Legacy: A Surplus of Single Men
summary: A decade after the end of the one-child policy, China has over 30 million so-called surplus men. Can this dating boot camp help them find love?

title: Measles Outbreak Hits Ave Maria University in Florida
summary: More than 40 people have fallen ill at Ave Maria University, raising fears that college campuses may soon experience more measles outbreaks.

title: New Research Absolves the Woman Blamed for a Dynasty’s Ruin
summary: A Chinese king’s infatuation with a woman was seen as the reason that a golden age collapsed. Evidence suggests climate change and internal strife played bigger roles.

title: Florida Couple Arrested After Pickleball Match Turns Into a Brawl
summary: The couple, who were banned for life from a country club in Port Orange, Fla., face felony battery charges after the fight, which involved 20 people, the authorities said.

title: After a Harrowing Water Rescue, Baby Is Delivered on Mother’s Birthday
summary: Shedly Apollon was on her way to a prenatal massage when she started to feel faint while on the road. Her car veered off the highway and into a lake.
